channel.title: Auto Scroll
channel.description: I have this site that opens the runescape applet in an iFrame. Is there any way for me to have it auto-scroll a given amount, so it will block out the adverts?

item.title: Auto Scroll
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Oh god, no.You’re using a frameset, which won’t allow you to add any other code. Use inline frames instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Scroll
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

So it should look like:

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Frameset//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-frameset.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<link rel="shortcut icon" href="/sr/favicon.ico" type="image/x-icon" />
<link rel="icon" href="/sr/favicon.ico" type="image/x-icon" />
<link href="style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1" />
<title>Untitled Document</title>
</head>
<?php
...
    if ($currworld != 0)
      echo "<frame src=\"$worldurl\" name=\"mainFrame\" scrolling=\"No\" id=\"mainFrame\" title=\"mainFrame\" />";
    else
      echo "<frame src=\"mainFrame.php\" name=\"mainFrame\" scrolling=\"No\" id=\"mainFrame\" title=\"mainFrame\" />";
    ?>
    <frame src="/sr/bottomFrame.php" name="rightFrame" scrolling="No" id="scoresFrame" title="scoresFrame" />
  <frame src="UntitledFrame-1"></frameset>
  <frameset rows="100, 210, 90, *">
	 <frame src="/sr/newsFrame.php" name="newsFrame" scrolling="No" noresize="noresize" id="newsFrame" title="newsFrame" />
     <frame src="/sr/rightFrame.php" name="rightFrame" scrolling="No" noresize="noresize" id="rightFrame" title="rightFrame" />
	 <frame src="/sr/calcFrame.php" name="calcFrame" scrolling="No" noresize="noresize" id="calcFrame" title="calcFrame" />
     <frame src="/sr/scoresFrame.php" name="scoresFrame" scrolling="No" noresize="noresize" id="scoresFrame" title="scoresFrame" />
  </frameset>
  </frameset>

<noframes><body>
<script type="text/javascript" language="javascript">
mainFrame.scroll(0, 200);
</script>
</body>
</noframes>
</html>

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Scroll
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

I dont know what you mean but heres auto scroll kinda of script :P.


<script language=javascript>
var rev = "fwd";
function titlebar(val)
{
var msg = "Your message here *** ";
var res = " ";
var speed = 100;
var pos = val;

msg = " |--- "+msg+" ---|";
var le = msg.length;
if(rev == "fwd"){
if(pos < le){
pos = pos+1;
scroll = msg.substr(0,pos);
document.title = scroll;
timer = window.setTimeout("titlebar("+pos+")",speed);
}
else{
rev = "bwd";
timer = window.setTimeout("titlebar("+pos+")",speed);
}
}
else{
if(pos > 0){
pos = pos-1;
var ale = le-pos;
scrol = msg.substr(ale,le);
document.title = scrol;
timer = window.setTimeout("titlebar("+pos+")",speed);
}
else{
rev = "fwd";
timer = window.setTimeout("titlebar("+pos+")",speed);
}
}
}

titlebar(0);
</script>

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Scroll
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:6, topic:35561”][quote author=alexia link=topic=50912.msg643167#msg643167 date=1166451549]

FF2 does NOT block adverts.

yes it does. I havent seen any ad in ages at all. it has this adblock feature

Are you retarded? Scroll up. Do you not see the adds at the top of the page?

-Alexia
[/quote]

what ads? I havent seen a runescape ad on ANY browser in over a year (not even the official downloaded client)

and theres ads on this site?[/quote]
There are banner ads on the main page and on any any free worlds…if you have a 3rd party ad blocker, obviously they won’t show in any browser. I use the firefox adblock extension, which does actually physically remove the add from the page (which is why you don’t have to scroll down).

xxlegitxx:

I have this site that opens the runescape applet in an iFrame. Is there any way for me to have it auto-scroll a given amount, so it will block out the adverts?

window.scroll(0, yPos)

Read full topic
